abstract: The album, called "Lioness: Hidden Treasures," will be released on Dec. 5 by Island Records and will include Ms. Winehouse's covers of songs like "Will You Still Love Me Tomorrow" and "The Girl From Ipanema" as well as original compositions.
snippet: The album, called "Lioness: Hidden Treasures," will be released on Dec. 5 by Island Records and will include Ms. Winehouse's covers of songs like "Will You Still Love Me Tomorrow" and "The Girl From Ipanema" as well as original compositions.
lead_paragraph: An album of material recorded by Amy Winehouse before she died, including new tracks as well as reworked versions of songs made popular by her and other artists, will be released on Dec. 5, an announcement on her Web site said Monday. The album, called "Lioness: Hidden Treasures," will be released by Island Records, which released her two previous albums, "Frank" and "Back to Black," and will contain 12 tracks Ms. Winehouse recorded between 2002 and 2008, including covers of "Will You Still Love Me Tomorrow" and "The Girl From Ipanema." Other songs include a slower-tempo version of Ms. Winehouse's hit "Valerie" and a new composition called "Between the Cheats" that Ms. Winehouse planned to include on a possible follow-up to "Back to Black."

headline.main: Posthumous Amy Winehouse Album Will Be Released in December
